intro: Saccoloma minus, commonly known as the small saccoloma, is a species of fern belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen fronds that are typically less than 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces sporangia on the underside of its leaves, which are clustered in small, rounded structures called sori. Saccoloma minus thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species within its native habitat.
